qIsSemantic.desc: If set to true, it means that the field is a semantic.

qIsHidden.desc: If set to true, it means that the field is hidden.

q IsSystem.desc: If set to true, it means that the field is a system field.

qAndMode.desc:
If set to true a logical AND (instead of a logical OR) is used when making selections in a field.
The default value is false.

qTags.desc:
Gives information on a field. For example, it can return the type of the field.
Examples: key, text, ASCII

qIsDefinitionOnly.desc: If set to true, it means that the field is a field on the fly.

qDerivedFieldData.desc: Lists the derived fields if any.

qIsDetail.desc:
Is used for Direct Discovery.
If set to true, it means that the type of the field is detail.

qIsImplicit.desc:
Is used for Direct Discovery.
If set to true, it means that the type of the field is measure.
